resource_dependency.todoDataSchema: Database table named 'todos' with columns: id (UUID, primary key), title (string, not null), description (text), due_date (timestamp), completed (boolean, default false), created_at (timestamp, default now()), updated_at (timestamp, default now())

function: Fetch all to-do items from the backend API and display them in a list view.
static_description: A page with a lavender background containing an indigo-themed header bar, a main content area showing a list of to-do items. Each item displays its title, truncated description, due date, and completion status using indigo-styled cards or rows.

interaction_and_states.description: On initial load, the frontend makes a GET request to /api/todos to retrieve all to-do items and renders them in the list view.

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables for storing to-do data.
static_description: Backend server configuration file specifying how to connect to PostgreSQL using the given environment variables. No visible UI element as this is a backend-only component.

function: Allow users to create new to-do items by submitting a form with title, description, and due date.
static_description: An indigo-styled modal or form overlay on the lavender background with input fields for title (text), description (textarea), and due date (date picker). Submit and cancel buttons are present.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Add Task' button opens the creation form. Clicking 'Submit' sends a POST request to /api/todos with the form data after validating required fields.
Pressing Enter while focused on any input field triggers validation and submission of the form if valid.

function: Enable editing of existing to-do items including their title, description, and due date.
static_description: A pre-filled indigo-styled form similar to the creation form but populated with the selected taskâ€™s current data. It includes save and cancel buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the edit icon/pencil next to a task opens the edit form. Saving updates the task via PUT request to /api/todos/{id}.

function: Permit deletion of to-do items permanently through a delete action.
static_description: Each task card or row contains a trash/delete icon styled in indigo. There is no separate confirmation dialog shown in static view.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the delete/trash icon sends a DELETE request to /api/todos/{id}, removing the task from the list upon successful response.

function: Provide ability to mark tasks as completed or uncompleted with immediate visual feedback.
static_description: Each task shows a checkbox or toggle switch aligned left within an indigo-styled container indicating completion status.

interaction_and_states.description: Toggling the checkbox sends a PATCH request to update the task's completed status. The UI reflects the change immediately without full reload.

function: Offer filtering options to show only All, Active, or Completed tasks.
static_description: Three indigo-styled filter tabs/buttons labeled 'All', 'Active', and 'Completed' positioned above the task list on the lavender background.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a filter tab sends a GET request to /api/todos?filter=value which returns filtered results and updates the displayed list accordingly.

function: Implement search functionality allowing users to find tasks by keywords in title or description.
static_description: A search bar/input field styled with indigo theme located at the top of the task list section against the lavender background.

interaction_and_states.description: As the user types into the search box, debounced GET requests are sent to /api/todos?search=query updating the task list dynamically.

resource_dependency.taskListViewLayout: Card-based or table layout displaying title, description snippet, due date, and status per task

function: Present all to-do items in a clear list view with essential information visible at a glance.
static_description: Main content area filled with vertically stacked indigo-styled cards or horizontally aligned rows showing each task's key details on a lavender background.

resource_dependency.responsiveDesignSpecs: CSS media queries ensuring layout adapts to mobile/tablet/desktop screens maintaining lavender background and indigo components

function: Ensure consistent styling with lavender background and indigo components across devices and screen sizes.
static_description: Entire application interface uses lavender (#E6E6FA) as the base background color and indigo (#4B0082) for interactive components like buttons, inputs, headers, etc., regardless of viewport size.

resource_dependency.websocketOrPollingMechanism: WebSocket or polling mechanism for real-time sync

function: Maintain real-time synchronization between frontend and backend during all CRUD operations.
static_description: No direct visual representation; involves underlying communication protocols keeping frontend and backend synchronized automatically.

resource_dependency.errorHandlingUI: Toast notifications or inline error messages

function: Handle errors gracefully such as failed API calls or database issues with informative feedback.
static_description: Toast-style notification popups or inline error banners appear near relevant actions/forms when failures occur, styled consistently with the lavender-indigo theme.

resource_dependency.validationRules: Title is required; description optional; due date optional but must be future if provided

function: Enforce validation on mandatory fields when creating or editing tasks before sending data to backend.
static_description: Red-colored hint texts or border highlights appear beneath invalid fields in forms, prompting corrections before submission.

interaction_and_states.description: If title is empty, prevent form submission and highlight the title field with an error message until corrected.

resource_dependency.paginationControls: Next/Previous buttons or infinite scroll trigger

function: Support pagination or infinite scrolling for efficient browsing of large numbers of tasks.
static_description: At the bottom of the task list, either numbered pagination links or a 'Load More' button appears depending on implementation choice.

interaction_and_states.description: Reaching end of list triggers loading more tasks via GET /api/todos?page=x&limit=y or clicking pagination loads next set of tasks.

resource_dependency.packageJsonScripts: { "install:all": "concurrently \"npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"npm run dev --prefix frontend\" \"npm run dev --prefix backend\"" }

function: Configure package.json scripts to manage installation and development startup of both frontend and backend concurrently.
static_description: The root level package.json file includes custom scripts under 'scripts' section enabling dual-installation and concurrent execution.
